On Jan 22, 2007, at 2:59 PM, Alan Dean wrote:
> As it happens, I write in .net and the runtime sinks ETag headers if
> they are set because a 201 response is not cacheable.

That's dumb.  Which version of the runtime?

...
> I have to admit it seems odd to send an ETag along with a response
> marked no-cache, but it is permitted by the spec if you wish to do so.

ETag is not an entity-header. ETag provides information about the
resource, not the current message, so it is orthogonal to cache
control.

....Roy
